alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 6:02PM MDT until September 13 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following counties, in central New Mexico, Bernalillo. In north central New Mexico, Sandoval. * WHEN...Until 800 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 601 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms tracking towards the northeast. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northern Albuquerque, Rio Rancho, Bernalillo, Corrales, Los Ranchos De Albuquerque, San Ysidro, Northern Meadows, Mariposa, Rio Rancho City Center, Zia Pueblo, Cabezon, Vista Hills, Rio Rancho Intel Area, Paradise Hills, Enchanted Hills, Sandia Pueblo, North Valley and Alameda. - This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 3 and 33. Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 228 and 229...and between Mile Markers 231 and 240. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
